page.title: 11THREE ASHES NEAR CLUNBURY
page.content: In{Twitchen,}a tiny hamlet near {Clunbury,}three parishes meet at the {Three Ashes.}The{Three Ashes}were put there over 100 years ago, long before any one can remember. Now there is only one ash, the other two either died of old age or were chopped down for being too dangerous and overhanging the road. The one still standing might be chopped down soon because it sways in strong winds and may fall down. The reason why the {Three Ashes}are so well known is because although the trees are close together in the junction of two county roads, each one was in a different parish,{Clungunford, Hopton Castle}and {Clunbury.}They are visited in the summer by walkers on holiday in the area.
